de.esoco.ewt.app

Interface EWTModule


  • public interface EWTModule
    An EWT module is the part of an EWT application that contains the user interface code. The intention behind this is that the module code should be as independent from a particular EWT platform as possible. This makes it easier to port application code between different EWT implementations. Any platform-specific application code should be put in a subclass of the respective application class which is different for several EWT variants. For GEWT, the base class for applications is EWTEntryPoint.

    Implementing an EWT application typically means to providing at least two classes: an application class containing the bootstrap and platform-specific code and a module that contains the platform-independent user interface code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      View createModuleView(UserInterfaceContext rContext)
      This method must be implemented by subclasses to create and return the module's main view.
      void showModuleView(UserInterfaceContext rContext, View rView)
      This method will be invoked by the EWT framework to display a view previously created by createModuleView(UserInterfaceContext).

    • Method Detail

      • createModuleView

        View createModuleView(UserInterfaceContext rContext)
        This method must be implemented by subclasses to create and return the module's main view. If required by the platform this method will be invoked on the user interface thread so the implementation doesn't need to care about thread synchronization.

        The implementation should neither invoke View.pack() nor make the view visible already. Packing and displaying the view should only be done in the method showModuleView(UserInterfaceContext, View) which will be invoked by the framework after the creation. This separation allows EWT implementations to apply any platform-specific attributes to the main application view if necessary.

        This method should not set a menu bar on the view because menus are handled differently

        If the module view cannot be created for some reason this method should throw a RuntimeException. It must not return NULL.

        Parameters:
        rContext - The user interface context to create the view in
        Returns:
        The module's main view

      • showModuleView

        void showModuleView(UserInterfaceContext rContext,
                    View rView)
        This method will be invoked by the EWT framework to display a view previously created by createModuleView(UserInterfaceContext). Typically it should prepare the view by invoking View.pack() and then display it on the screen, e.g. with one of the display methods in the UserInterfaceContext.
        Parameters:
        rContext - The user interface context of the view
        rView - The view to display
